data.title: john lynch Archives
data.text:
Review: BOYS FROM COUNTY HELL Is An Irish Vampire Film With Bite

Writer/director Chris Baugh delivers a hugely entertaining comedy/horror with Boys From County Hell. The Irish vampire film is perfectly balanced – it’s loaded with laughs, scares, gore and a lot of heart – and this makes it a [...]

New Irish & UK Release Date For Chris Baugh’s Brilliant BOYS FROM COUNTY HELL

Movies In Focus has seen Chris Baugh’s brilliant horror-comedy Boys From County Hell – and it delivers everything that you would ever want from a vampire film set in rural Ireland (read the full review). Baugh’s pic was supposed [...]

Chris Baugh’s Brilliant BOYS FROM COUNTY HELL Gets UK Cinema Release This June

Movies In Focus has seen Chris Baugh’s Boys From County Hell – and it delivers everything that you would ever want from a vampire film set in rural Ireland (read the full review). UK audiences won’t have to wait long before they [...]

Review: Horror/Comedy BOYS FROM COUNTY HELL Is A Vampire Movie With An Irish Twist

Writer/director Chris Baugh delivers a hugely entertaining comedy/horror with Boys From County Hell. The Irish vampire film is perfectly balanced – it’s loaded with laughs, scares, gore and a lot of heart – and this makes it a [...]

Review: THE BANISHING Is A Surprisingly Original Chiller With Great Performances

Over the decades there have been so many haunted house horror films that you have to wonder if a filmmaker can bring something unique to the over-used trope. However, director Christopher Smith (Severance, Black Death, Triangle) manages to take the [...]

Trailer & Poster: Irish Comedy-Horror BOYS FROM COUNTY HELL Looks To Have Gore Galore

Going by this trailer, there will be plenty of fun to be had from Boys From County Hell. This looks like an enjoyable comedy-horror with gore galore from Bad Day For The Cut director Chris Baugh. The plot sees a group of friends unlocking a vampire [...]

Trailer For Christopher Smith’s THE BANISHING Starring Jessica Brown Findlay, John Lynch & Sean Harris

Pitched as ‘The Shining meets Downton Abbey‘ director Christopher Smith‘s The Banishing is a new 1930s set ghost story with an impressive cast: Jessica Brown Findlay, John Lynch, Sean Harris and Adam Hugill. Movies In Focus is [...]

Uncovering Curiosities: Brendan Muldowney’s PILGRIMAGE

Spider-Man star Tom Holland takes the lead in Pilgrimage, a medieval Irish thriller that sees a group of monks protecting an ancient holy relic against heathens and those who want to use it as a source of political power. Pilgrimage is an engaging [...]

Uncovering Curiosities: Billy O’Brien’s SCINTILLA

Scintilla (also known as The Hybrid) shows once again that you don’t need a mega budget to deliver a captivating science fiction feature. Writer/director Billy O’Brien’s film may not break new ground in a narrative sense, but it works as a [...]

Uncovering Curiosities: Richard Stanley’s HARDWARE

It’s hard to believe that Richard Stanley’s Hardware is celebrating its 25th anniversary. This science fiction horror marked Stanley’s directorial debut and it showed him to be a unique voice in the world of genre filmmaking. Stanley was on [...]

Blu-ray Review: Tom Holland Ditches The Spidey Spandex And Goes On A PILGRIMAGE

New Spider-Man Tom Holland takes the lead in Pilgrimage, a medieval Irish thriller that sees a group of monks protecting an ancient holy relic against heathens and those who want to use it as a source of political power. Pilgrimage is an engaging [...]

DVD Review: 25th Anniversary Edition Of Richard Stanley’s Cult Sci-Fi Thriller HARDWARE

It’s hard to believe that Richard Stanley’s Hardware is celebrating its 25th anniversary. This science fiction horror marked Stanley’s directorial debut and it showed him to be a unique voice in the world of genre filmmaking. Stanley was on [...]

DVD Review: Gillian Anderson And Jamie Dornan In THE FALL Series 2

Movies in Focus can often be very critical of British television. Even when it’s firing on all cylinders on a script level, it never feels like it pushes the boundaries on a story telling or visual level. However, that changed with The Fall [...]
